meanings.definition: A person who owes something, typically money.
meanings.sent1: The ower paid back the borrowed money.
meanings.sent2: The ower owed a debt to the bank.
meanings.sent3: The ower realized it was time to settle the loan.
meanings.sent4: The ower was like a human ATM for his friends.
meanings.sent5: The ower's debt hung over him like a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: To be under a moral or legal obligation to do something.
meanings.sent1: She felt ower to return the lost wallet.
meanings.sent2: He owered to fulfill his promise to help.
meanings.sent3: The student owered to complete the assignment before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The oath owered him to protect the secret with his life.
meanings.sent5: The hero's duty owered him to save the city from destruction.

meanings.sent1: The cake was ower enough to feed the entire party.
meanings.sent2: She was ower happy to see her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was ower cold on that freezing day.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was ower evident when he won the race.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset were ower beautiful over the ocean.
